alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 27 at 8:42AM PDT until October 28 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation if left unprotected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds from the Columbia River Gorge will increase tonight. This will likely keep Portland and Vancouver metro near the Gorge above freezing. However outlying areas such as the Tualatin Valley and rural Clark county are likely to have freezing temperatures tonight.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
